Sentence: It opens with the main characters, George and Martha coming home from a party at her (Martha) father's house
In the first act, ', "``Fun and Games,''  (Martha)', "Martha and George try to fight and humiliate each other in new, inventive ways

As they peel away each other's pretenses and self-respect, George and Martha use Honey and Nick as pawns, transforming their guests into an audience to witness humiliation, into levers for creating jealousy, and into a means for expressing their own sides of their mutual story
George and Martha even attack Honey and Nick, attempting to force them to reveal their dirty secrets and true selves
Honey and Nick go home, leaving Martha and George to try to rebuild their shattered marriage
